title: How to Make Grape Syrup

steps.headline: Cook the grapes over a medium heat in a saucepan.
Remove them from the heat when they start to "break" from the skins.
Pour the grapes in a bowl.
steps.description: Use a potato masher to complete the "breaking down" method.

steps.headline: Place the mixture in a strainer.
steps.description: Reserve all juices and toss the skins and seeds.

steps.headline: Add the juices back into a saucepan and bring to a light boil.
steps.description: Mix the sugar and corn syrup in the pan and put it to a simmer until the mixture is thickened.

tyn: 2 half-pint glass jars with metal lids
text: Cook the grapes over a medium heat in a saucepan.  Remove them from the heat when they start to "break" from the skins.  Pour the grapes in a bowl. Use a potato masher to complete the "breaking down" method. Place the mixture in a strainer. Reserve all juices and toss the skins and seeds. Add the juices back into a saucepan and bring to a light boil. Mix the sugar and corn syrup in the pan and put it to a simmer until the mixture is thickened.
